message:
Telnet Record/Playback tool urgently needed 
I am working in a project where I need to do a lot of telnet and then do testing/development on the stream coming from the server, I was asking if there is any known software that can record and then playback the telnet stream so I can run the test cases when I am not able to connect to the specific servers, anyone aware of such a tool ?

data.message: in apache commons there is an api for telnet. u can easily write ur own tests as you wish. i ve done the same.
Will I need a specific telnet server ? or the API will do this part for me ?
I was looking into it :) thanks a lot ya kibeer :)))
u basicly get the telnetclient object and then open the output and input streams.
it just works for any telnet server as far as i seen

I think it would be very easy to create that tool yourself as a quick console app, record mode will be a client that saves everything it recieves into a file, playback mode will be a server sending everything in that saved file :)
Another way to achieve the same goal (the ability to test) is to abstract your code by creating an interface which has two implementations, the default one being the actual telnet client, and the other is a fake one for testing that just replies to you as if it's connected to a server :)

I am modifying an existing app so I can play with classes and interfaces during development but will fall back to needing the tool for fvt,  I will go for the console app , may try python if I find a suitable api
